metadata.name: PUA - Chisel Tunneling Tool Execution
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the Chisel tunneling tool via the commandline arguments

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\chisel.exe')) OR (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('exe client ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('exe server '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-socks5')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-reverse')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' r:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':127.0.0.1:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-tls-skip-verify ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':socks')))))

output.summary: Detects usage of the Chisel tunneling tool via the commandline arguments

metadata.objective: False positive: Some false positives may occur with other tools with similar commandlines References: https://github.com/jpillora/chisel/, https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog/lorenz-ransomware-chiseling-in/, https://blog.sekoia.io/lucky-mouse-incident-response-to-detection-engineering/
